text: hello this is crash course biology and
that is your host Hank green in the next
40 episodes we'll roughly follow the
2012 ap biology curriculum and explore
the world of living things which as you
know it's a lot of things we'll start
with some chemistry covering the
elements and molecules that make up the
building blocks of life will discover
the make up of DNA and how it provides
the instructions for cells to become a
zebra or a pine tree or a sea sponge
you'll learn about organ systems
protists and cellular respiration by the
end you'll be more prepared to take on
your AP exam learn more in crash course
ecology or just appreciate the living
things all around you throughout this
series we'll introduce you to the
scientists that helped build our
understanding of biology through our
cleverly named segment biography we'll
cover the big stars of biology like
Chuck Darwin and Gilbert Lewis and some
of the lesser known but still important
researchers like rosalind Franklin and
Peter and Rosemary grant they'll be
guest appearances by John Green some
excellent dogs and regrettably Hanks
goatee during this course you'll learn
what's going on inside of you and all of
the plants and animals
tardigrades and fungi that live around
us and we have more in common than you
might think ready to find out what makes
life happen and how all living things
keep growing changing and evolving over
time well we'll get started in episode 1
